intro: Poa sudetica var. densa, commonly known as the dense meadow grass, is a variant of the common meadow grass species. It is a perennial grass that typically grows in temperate regions, particularly in Europe. The plant features slender,丛生 stems that produce dense clusters of small, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its characteristic appearance. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands.
